com.nttdocomo.ui
Interface MediaResource

All Known Subinterfaces:
MediaData, MediaImage, MediaSound
public interface MediaResource

This defines the media resource data. This media resource interface designates the interface that must be implemented by the media data class.
The media resource shall declare the start of use via use() before use, and the end of use via unuse() after use. Also, when the media resource is to be used no longer, it must be disposed of via dispose(). When method other than dispose () is called for the object after calling the dispose method, UIException is generated. The operation when undisposed media resources are about to be collected via GC is undefined.

See Also:
MediaManager

Method Summary
 void dispose()
          This disposes of media resources.
 void unuse()
          This declares the end of media resource use.
 void use()
          This declares the start of media resource use.
 

Method Detail

use

public void use()
         throws ConnectionException,
                UIException
This declares the start of media resource use. When this method is issued, the media resource is actually loaded and converted into an internal representation format.

Throws:
ConnectionException - Generated when an exception generated during the network communication and the like . When there is no network service or when out of range, OUT_OF_SERVICE is set for the status. TIMEOUT is set when timed out..
UIException - Generated when the data format is not playable by UEs. (UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT).
UIException - Generated when necessary resources cannot be secured (NO_RESOURCES).
java.lang.SecurityException - Generated when security restrictions are violated.

unuse

public void unuse()
This declares the end of media resource use. When this method is called while playing media resources with the media presenter, this resource falls into unusable status.

dispose

public void dispose()
This disposes of media resources. When this method is called while playing a media resource with the media presenter, the resource falls into a disposed status. When method other than dispose method is called after calling this method, UIException is generated(ILLEGAL_STATE). When dispose method is called after calling this method, nothing generated.

See Also:
use(), unuse()
